general_advisory: For better agriculture benefits use, OUAT KALINGA products ( Seedling, Sampling & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits and Vegetables, Value added products, Fingerlings/Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom and Spawns, Bio -fertilizers, Bio -pesticides, Vermi & Vermi Compost).

advisory: Stage - Fruiting
Wilting
Drain out excess of water after the rainfall.
Apply Plantomycin  @ 2gram/liter along with Tebuconazole@ 1gram/liter
Stage - Fruiting
Shoot and fruit borer
Set up pheromone trap @ 12/ha.
Collection and destruction of affected fruits.
Spray any one of the insecticides Azadirachtin 0.03% WSP (300 ppm)  @ 5.0 g/lit, Buprofezin 70 DF @5.5 ml/10 lit , Quinalphos 25 % EC @ 8.0 ml/10 lit , Emamectin benzoate 5 % SG @3.0 g/10 lit.
Stage - Tillering
Blast disease may occur due to alternate drying and wetting condition so it is necessary to keep standing water in rice field.
Spray Hexaconazole or Tricyclazole@0.7gram/ liter) at 15 days interval regularly.
Stage - Tasselling
To manage the fall army worm pest, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5 % S.G @ 80 -gram/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C @ 80 -ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.
Use 10 -12 bird perches per acre and remove them before tasselling stage.
Stage - fruiting - fusarium wilt
Fusarium wilt is characterized by wilting of the plant and upward and inward rolling of the leaves.
Uproot the infected plants and dispose it safely.
Drenching with 1% Bordeaux mixture or blue copper or Fytolan 0.25% may give protection.
In Niger crop, apply 25% of Nitrogen at pre flowering stage.
Fertilizer dose is 40:40:20 kg/ha of N PK.
Rhizome rot.
Apply Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets and Neem oil @ 75 ml/15 liter of water as curative measures.
Close and cover the holes on the floor as it may reside the snakes or rats which can kill the chicks.
Provide optimum amount of food and clean drinking water.
